reviewText: BEGGING ON MY HANDS AND KNEES!!!  PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE ISSUE THIS IN US FORMAT!!!  I'M NOT A TV BUG!!!  AND IF I RAVE ABOUT A TV SHOW, THE CHANCE IS DECENT, IT'S PROBABLY PRETTY GOOD!  SAW THIS AGES AGO WHEN IT WAS ON TV, AND AMAZINGLY, NOT ON PBS!!!In other words, before companies who wanted to sell us things actually owned the TV networks and these incredibly bad so-called "reality" shows dominated ABC, CBS and NBC!  Remember top-notch shows like The Twilight Zone?  What about The Waltons?  Mary Tyler Moore anyone, and how about the outstahding spin-off, Lou Grant?Everything about this series is top-notch!  Wait until I tell my husband!  He also saw it, and we both mention it on a fairly regular basis!  Now, if they would only release "We, The Accused" and the version of "Rebecca" where Joanna David played Mrs. DeWinter...Ahhh...."To Sleep, Perchance To Dream..."
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love this movie !!!  I saw it years ago, when I was in high school in the late 70's.  I purchased the DVD set, but I can't watch it anymore because my region free dvd player stopped working.  I really wish they would release this film in USA format.

reviewText: I saw this mini series one time back in 1978 when stationed in Germany as a young AF member. I thought it was an enlightening and educational series. I would have never known that, that was how the country of Australia was developed.I found the story very well written and directed.I wish the producers would re-release it, but this time make a version playable in the USA.I'd love to see it again.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was a great mini series that I remember seeing a long time ago.  The characters have substance and are realistic, and most are very likeable.  I think the settings, story, acting, etc. are all wonderful; an overall quality production.  I just hope it will soon be available in a US format.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Another classic miniseries with the story set in the time of Australia's early penal settlement and convict past. Like Sarah Dane and For The Term of His Natural Life the story focuses on the transportation and survival of a convict against the harsh treatment from the officers in charge of(in this case a young Irish girl)her incarceration . Although my favourite Australian miniseries is For The Term of His Natural Life this is not to be undersold and the story is quite different. A young Bryan Brown stars at the beginning and the main male leading role is played by John English who played Judas in the Australian version of Jesus Christ Superstar.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Its great shows like this are being released on DVD these days.I saw this when i was a kid in the late 70's.I loved it at the time,there sure was some great shows around at the time.I just cant get into the modern movies and shows much.So i look around for entertaining shows like this.It was very well made,such as the settings on the long journey to Australia.You realy get the feel of how it would have been on one of those ships.I dont think i could handle that salted pork.Jon English wrote the song Six Ribbons for this show,he also starred in it.The series itself is based on the life of Mary Mulvane,who lived in Ireland was convicted and sent to Australia for 7 years.But after her sentence was served had made friends and was well established.I think this is one of the best mini series that came from Australia.
Title: N/A
